value.excerpt: How can you find, collect, and clean data from different sources? Power BI is a tool for making sense of your data. You will learn tricks to make data-gathering easier.

value.title: Get started with Microsoft Fabric
value.excerpt: Get started and explore the capabilities of Microsoft Fabric.

topItems.title: Introduction to end-to-end analytics using Microsoft Fabric
topItems.excerpt: Discover how Microsoft Fabric can meet your enterprise's analytics needs in one platform. Discover the capabilities Fabric has to offer, understand how it works, and identify how you can use Fabric for your analytics needs.

topItems.title: Get started with lakehouses in Microsoft Fabric
topItems.excerpt: Get started with lakehouses in Microsoft Fabric

topItems.title: Use Apache Spark in Microsoft Fabric
topItems.excerpt: Apache Spark is a core technology for large-scale data analytics. Microsoft Fabric provides support for Spark clusters, enabling you to analyze and process data at scale.

topItems.title: Work with Delta Lake tables in Microsoft Fabric
topItems.excerpt: Tables in a Microsoft Fabric lakehouse are based on the Delta Lake technology commonly used in Apache Spark. By using the enhanced capabilities of delta tables, you can create advanced analytics solutions.

value.title: Get started with the Power BI Gateway
value.excerpt: Get to know what the Power BI Gateway is along with how to get it setup for scheduled refresh of imported data. value.title: Design and build tabular models
value.excerpt: Design and build tabular models

topItems.title: Create Power BI model relationships
topItems.excerpt: Power BI model relationships form the basis of a tabular model. Define Power BI model relationships, set up relationships, recognize DAX relationship functions, and describe relationship evaluation.

topItems.title: Use DAX time intelligence functions in Power BI Desktop models
topItems.excerpt: By the end of this module, you'll learn the meaning of time intelligence and how to add time intelligence DAX calculations to your model. These calculations will include year-to-date (YTD), year-over-year (YoY) growth, and others.

topItems.title: Create calculation groups
topItems.excerpt: Power BI, calculation groups, enterprise data analyst

topItems.title: Enforce Power BI model security
topItems.excerpt: Enforce model security in Power BI using row-level security and object-level security.

value.title: Explore what Power BI can do for you
value.excerpt: As a consumer, you'll work in the Power BI service to review and interact with content that has been shared with you. This module provides the foundational information that you need to work effectively in the Power BI service.

value.title: Write DAX formulas for Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to write DAX formulas to create calculated tables, calculated columns, and measures, which are different types of model calculations. Additionally, you'll learn how to write and format DAX formulas, which consist of expressions that use functions, operators, references to model objects, constants, and variables.
